description.narrative: Danida Innovation & Business Explorer (DIBE) offers financial support to Danish companies, including start-ups, that wish to investigate concrete business opportunities contributing to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and the Paris agreement. Nigeria, over 190 million inhabitants, half of them living in rural areas in disparate regions, and only 48% as a rate of electrification. With an average power supply of 3.1GW, being utilized at 78% for residential use, the country is facing a power shortage that is far from being satisfied. with 2.63% demographic growth rate, the population is still relying for 82.2% of its energy supply on fossil fuel. With its experience, NTU will offer a substantial leapfrogging opportunity in clean energy production. RECON Project aims at enabling local rural communities to not only access clean energy, through already tested viable hybrid solutions, but also to develop their capacities to manage and maintain the mini grids through local energy cooperatives. Hybrid mini grids have already been tested in theory and confirmed to offer the best solution for clean energy for small communities. RECON Project is the optimal commercial, and socially oriented approach to apply the theories in practice, in close cooperation with OEMs. This will not only guarantee access to clean energy, it will also generate a series of SDGs related positive outcomes.
